mdRecord.dcterms:title: Les provinces des Pays-Bas Catholiques ou A most exact map of Flanders or ye Austrian Netherlands &c: It comprehends all the towns, villages, abbeys, monasteries throughout all these provinces &c / By H. Moll, Geographer
Most exact map of Flanders or ye Austrian Netherlands &c
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Moll, Herman, -1732 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 1 map : col. ; 61 x 100 cm. on sheet 64 x 106 cm.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Relief shown pictorially and by soundings. [original]
Prime meridians: London and Ferro Island. [original]
Text just to the right of the title cartouche describes terms of a "treaty for settling the barrier in the Netherlands" which was signed at Antwerp in November 1715. [original]

Insets: Plan du toutes sortes d'ouvrages dont on se sert dans les fortifications... = A plan of all manner of works used in fortification... -- Carte des Grand Chemins de Paris a Valenciene = A map of the roads from Paris to Valenciene -- La partie meridionale de Luxembourgh est continuée icy = The south part of Luxembourgh is continued here. [original]
Some notes are in French and English. [original]
Note at lower center explains that this map is based on a survey of the Spanish Netherlands published at Brussels by Mr. Fricz. [original]
Towns color coded to show French, Dutch and Flemish possessions. [original]
Dedication: To His Grace Iames Duke of Ormond, Captain General of Her Majesty's Forces &c. This map is humbly dedicated by your Lordship's most humble servant Herman Moll Geogr. [original]
An earlier issue of the map, ca. 1914, has only the Moll imprint. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: "Flanders" written in brown ink on verso. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Benelux countries--Maps--Early works to 1800
Belgium--Maps--Early works to 1800
Luxembourg--Maps--Early works to 1800
Netherlands--Maps--Early works to 1800
